page.title: 18Bradninch Farming
page.content: { Bradninch}has many surrounding{farms. We chose several, among them being Hele Payne and Caseberry. Most of Hele Payne is crop land. We saw ploughed fields and one with mustard in it.The farm has 242 acres with 15 fields. Crops grown include{cereals,}oil seed, rape and forage maize. Some are permanent pasture. Animals include 1 cow,400 fattening pigs and 190 sheep. There are 4 tractors and a combine harvester. The house roof dates from medieval times. Both Mr. Shere at Caseberry and Mr. Selway at Moorland were very helpful.Mr. Shere owns 209 acres and has 101 cattle. Ian Selway attends our school as have his sisters.He hopes to follow the family farming tradition. { The Mayor of Bradninch}visited school and explained how husbandry worked.
